children.subject: If we are registering for multiple positions with the idea of tutoring one of them, would we fill out the joint application for CS 61a + CS 88 or fill out CS 61A and CS 88's separate applications (with the intent to tutor either 61A or 88)?

history.content:
Hi everyone, for those of you that don’t already know, Computer Science Mentors (CSM) is an organization that runs small group, weekly tutoring sections for most of the lower division CS classes (CS 61A/B/C, CS 70, EECS 16A/B, and CS 88) to supplement lectures and discussions. We wanted to share an opportunity for those of you who are potentially interested in joining CSM as a mentor next semester! This upcoming Tuesday (5/4), we will be hosting a CSM info session from 6-7pm PT. For the first 20 minutes, we will talk about what CSM does and how our new mentor recruiting process works. For the last 40 minutes, you can choose between individual course presentations from each of the courses CSM supports (61A, 61B, 61C, 16A, 16B, 88, and 70). Each course will talk about specific tips for succeeding on their application and interview, and will also have small breakout rooms where you'll be able to talk to mentors from that course and ask them questions about their experiences in CSM. We hope to see some of you on Tuesday and in CSM next semester!

Zoom Link: https://berkeley.zoom.us/j/97978274744?pwd=eFh3THFDeE9ZSUp2T0I2U2hXZ3JZdz09

Facebook Event: https://fb.me/e/18Pg5fTJh

Feel free to post a follow-up or reach out directly to me (jadesingh17@berkeley.edu) with any questions!
